event.title: settled by Scots-Irish settlers from Londonderry in 1736

data.event: It was first settled by Scots-Irish settlers from Londonderry in 1736 under the auspices of Brigadier-General Samuel Waldo, its proprietor.

event.title: 1753, a blockhouse was built and placed

data.event: In 1753, a blockhouse was built and placed under the command of Captain Thomas Kilpatrick, known by terrified Indians as "Tom-kill-the-devil."
Hostilities ended in 1759 with the Fall of Quebec.

event.title: November 7, 1776, Upper Town of St. Georges Plantation was incorporated

data.event: On November 7, 1776, Upper Town of St. Georges Plantation was incorporated as a town, named after Joseph Warren, a Revolutionary War hero.
Falls on the St. George River provided water power, with the first sawmill built in 1785.
The Knox and Lincoln Railroad opened on November 6, 1871.
